body.p: Well first thing I want to tell about what white fellow tell me at Wyeville about friend that go fishing up Onalaska and go fishing no one else with him and catch three big fish and bring them home. When he got home like fellow say he have big feast with his family and then take other fish over to neighbor and neighbor fellow laugh and tell him that is dog fish and nobody eat dog fish get pretty pale and look pretty sick. Lots of Indians and I know white people too eat dog fish and make them in big stew and dog fish taste pretty good fish and pretty good to eat. Indians some people think not as smart as white fellows but I tell you one thing pretty sure Indian know when he catch what kind of fish he has. Now I tell you what I know about how people don’t have enough to eat and times with all people get pretty bad. Two three year ago everybody talk about pretty soon we have good times again and everybody have plenty to eat and like that and white fellows that run government going to fix things up all o.k. Indian reporter been here long time and I know myself young Indian man that have family always have plenty to eat for family and have warm clothes in winter. When Indian reporter was young fellow have work all time and everybody work and get two dollars two dollars and half a day and take his money to town and get lots of things and money go pretty good. Now when go to store and have money to buy and fellow in store say first thing “How much money you got?” and only give you just few things that you want and money pretty soon all gone and I don’t think that very good times. And another thing I want to tell about all farmers around where I live and other places same thing have own farms few years back and now farmers don’t own farms and somebody else now have place and he work for them and that pretty bad too and nobody very happy. .
